abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Rural and Main
            Roads Project in Guatemala are to 1) support building up of
            the country's institutional capacity to administer and
            maintain rural roads; 2) improve the rural road system in
            the ZONAPAZ region, specifically the Department of San
            Marcos (part of the geographic area most affected by
            internal conflict before the December 1996 Peace Accords,
            where the government is focusing a major post-conflict
            development effort), critical to providing access to social
            and other public services and fostering economic development
            through integration to markets; and 3) continue to improve
            the efficiency of the main and secondary road networks. The
            components are three: 1) to develop and implement a national
            rural roads and transport strategy; 2) to implement a pilot
            rural roads component using innovative institutional
            arrangements for maintenance and rehabilitation including
            the testing of new technologies for cost-effective
            strengthening of rural road surfaces, and pilot a new
            institutional framework for road management and financing;
            and 3) to continue support, through consultant services and
            providing equipment, for rehabilitating the main and
            secondary road network.
